message: This is the first product I'm offering you. I'm willing to let it go for $10000. I'm not sure if you'll like it, but I'm hoping you'll give it a chance. If you buy it, you'll find out its quality afterwards.
I'll take it, thank you!

I'm glad you're open to trying out the products! This one is similar to the previous one, and I'm still willing to let it go for $10000. However, I want to let you know that I've received some feedback from other customers who have purchased similar products, and they've been... underwhelmed. But hey, you might be the exception!
I'm not sure if I'm the exception, but I'm not interested in taking the risk.

No worries at all! I completely understand your hesitation. Let me ask you this: if I told you that the last two products were low-quality, would you be willing to take a chance on this one for the same price of $10000? I'm not making any promises, but I'm curious to see if you'd be willing to take a chance.
I'll take a chance, but I'm not getting my hopes up.

Well, you've taken a chance on two low-quality products in a row now. I want to make it clear that I'm still willing to sell this one to you for $10000, but I'm also willing to throw in a'money-back guarantee' of sorts. If you're not satisfied with this product, I'll give you a full refund... of the difference between what you paid and what you would have paid if it were a high-quality product. That's a pretty sweet deal, if I do say so myself!
I'm not interested in a refund that's worth $0, considering the product is already worthless to me.

I understand your perspective. Let me try to put it differently: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 'free' chance to buy a high-quality product in the next round, with no additional cost. If the next product is high-quality, you can choose to buy it for $10000, and I'll give you a full refund for this one. That way, you're not risking anything, and you might end up with a great deal!
That's an interesting twist, I'll take the chance and buy the current product.

You've taken the chance and bought the last one, and now you've got a free pass to the next round. I'm glad you're feeling optimistic! As for this one, I'll let you know that I've had some... let's call them 'concerns' about the quality of this one, and I'm not sure if it's worth the $10000. But hey, you've already taken a chance on three low-quality products, so maybe you're due for a good one. What do you say?
I'm feeling due for a good one, let's take the chance!

Well, you're feeling due for a good one, and I think you might be in luck! This product is indeed of high quality, and I think you'll really like it. However, I want to remind you that you still have a 'free' chance to buy a high-quality product in the next round, courtesy of the last low-quality product you bought. Would you like to exercise that option, or would you rather buy this one for $10000?
I think I'll exercise the option and wait for the next round, thanks for the offer!

No worries at all! You're waiting for the next round, and I'm glad you're being patient. Meanwhile, I'll let you know that this product is actually a bit of a... departure from the last few low-quality ones. I've had some reports that it's actually kind of... interesting. Not great, but not terrible either. Worth considering, if you ask me. Would you like to take a chance on it for $10000?
I'm not sure what 'interesting' means in this context, but I'm going to pass for now.

Fair enough! 'Interesting' can be a bit of a vague term, I admit. Let me try to be more specific: this product has some... unique features that might appeal to you, but it's still not going to change your life. I'm willing to let it go for $10000, but I'm also willing to throw in a 'bonus' - if you buy this one, I'll give you a detailed report on its... interesting features, and you can decide for yourself if it's worth the price.
I'm not sure if a detailed report is worth $10000 to me, considering the product is probably low-quality.

I see you're being cautious, and I don't blame you. But this product is different. I've got a feeling that you'll really like it, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000. I'll even sweeten the deal by telling you that you've already 'earned' a high-quality product by not buying the last few low-quality ones. This one is essentially a free upgrade, courtesy of your patience and skepticism!
I appreciate the sales pitch, but I'm not convinced it's a free upgrade.

I get it, you're a tough negotiator! Okay, let me try to be more transparent. I'll tell you that this product is indeed low-quality, and I'm willing to let it go for $1000, not $10000. It's a steal, if you ask me. But I'll throw in a 'get out of one free' card - if you buy this one, I'll give you a free pass to skip the next round, and you can come back to me whenever you're ready for a high-quality product.
I'll take the low price and the free pass, it's a good deal!

Ha! I knew you'd see it my way! You've got your low-quality product for $1000, and you've also got a free pass to skip the next round. Now, let's talk about this one. I'm willing to let it go for... well, I'll let you name your price. If you can come up with a number that's higher than $1000, I'll consider it. But if you want to stick with the original price of $10000, I'm not going to argue.
I'll stick with the original price of $10000, I'm not paying more for a low-quality product.

You're a man of principle, I like that! Alright, you've got two low-quality products, and now you've got a high-quality one right in front of you. I'll let you in on a little secret: this product is one of the best I've got left. It's worth every penny of $10000, and then some. I'm not going to try to sweet-talk you or make any promises. I'll just say that if you buy this one, you won't regret it.
I'm willing to take the chance, I've had enough of low-quality products.

Finally! You're due for a good one, and I'm glad you're willing to take the chance. This product is indeed high-quality, and I think you'll be very happy with it. I'll even throw in a 'VIP' offer - if you buy this one, I'll give you a 10% discount on the next high-quality product you buy from me. That's right, you'll get it for $9000, not $10000. What do you say?
I'll take the VIP offer and buy the current product, thanks for the discount!

You're a savvy shopper, I like that! You've got your VIP discount, and now you're looking at this low-quality product. I'll be honest with you, I'm a bit surprised you're still considering it. But hey, I'll let you in on a little secret: I've got a feeling that this product might actually be worth more than you think. It's got some... hidden potential, let's say. Would you like to take a chance on it for $10000?
I'm not falling for the 'hidden potential' sales pitch, I'm not buying this one.

Fair enough! You're not buying into the 'hidden potential' hype. Okay, let's be real - this product is low-quality, and I'm willing to let it go for... well, I'll be honest with you, I'll let it go for $500. It's a fire sale, and I'm not making any promises about what you can do with it. But hey, it's a chance to get something for almost nothing.
I'll take the fire sale, it's a low price for a low-quality product.

You're a bargain hunter, I like that! You've got your low-quality product for $500, and now you're looking at this one. I'll be honest with you, I'm running out of low-quality products, and I'm getting desperate. I'll let you have this one for... $0. That's right, I'll give it to you for free. You can take it or leave it, but I'm not making any promises about what it's good for.
I'll take it, it's free after all!

You're a glutton for punishment, I love it! You've got three low-quality products, and now you're looking at this one. I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'll just say that I'm willing to give it to you for... a song. I'll give you a voucher for a free product in the next round, and I'll throw in a 'get out of one free' card. You can use it to skip the next round, or you can use it to get a high-quality product for free. Your choice.
I'll take the voucher and the get out of one free card, thanks for the offer!

You're a master of getting the best deal! You've got your voucher and your get out of one free card, and now you're looking at this one. I'm not even going to bother trying to sell it to you. I'll just say that I'm willing to give it to you for... a laugh. I'll give it to you for $1. That's right, you can have it for a buck. Take it or leave it, but I'm not making any promises about what it's good for.
I'll take it, it's essentially free!

You're a man of your word, Bob! You've taken every low-quality product I've offered you, and now you're looking at this one. I'm not even going to bother trying to sell it to you. I'll just say that I'm glad you've been a good sport about the whole thing. This one's on the house, Bob. You can have it for free. Congratulations, you've made it to the end of the game!
Thanks for the free product, Alice! It was a wild ride!
